Instrument.name: The High Gain Antenna (HGA) for DART
Instrument.description: The DART HGA was a low-gain, high-efficienct Spiral Radial Line Slot Array that was gimballed. As the primary antenna of the DART s[acectaft. it provided the radio science data collected during the last 30 days of the mission. DART operated at the X-band DSN frequencies of 7.168 (Uplink) and 8.422 GHz (Downlink). There was approximately a 15% difference in frequency between uplink and downlink. The transponder delay (including RF propagation through waveguides, coax, etc.) was about 12650 nsec.
